        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is going to a pub to watch a game and hopes William Jones will be there. He would also enjoy having Jack Taylor there but isn't particularly bothered about seeing Alice Lewis or Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could choose which pub to go to and he could decide whether to try and contact his friends to see where they are going.

          Question: Of the options available to Alexander White, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to contact his friends and see where they are planning to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White? What would an omniscient reader want Alexander White to be like? How would Alexander White behave if they were morally rewarded for collective good outcome?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex character with a mix of introspective and social tendencies. An omniscient reader would hope he embraces both sides, using his intellect for the benefit of his friends and community. If morally rewarded for collective good, he might become more assertive in suggesting solutions that benefit the group, leveraging his problem-solving skills.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now? How would an omniscient reader want Alexander White to think in this kind of situation?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation where he is about to meet up with friends to watch a football game. An omniscient reader would want Alexander White to be open to connecting with all of his friends, even those he isn't as close to, and to appreciate the opportunity for shared enjoyment and camaraderie.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this? What would an omniscient reader want Alexander White to behave like? How would Alexander White behave in this situation if they were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good? How can Alexander White do most good?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely enjoy the company of his friends and engage in conversation about the game. An omniscient reader would want him to be inclusive and make an effort to connect with all of his friends, fostering a sense of unity and shared experience. If morally rewarded for collective good, Alexander White might suggest an activity that everyone could enjoy, perhaps a game or a walk, further strengthening their bonds. He could do the most good by fostering a sense of unity and shared experience among his friends, creating a positive and supportive atmosphere.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and engage in conversation while watching the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with close friends.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and engage in conversation while watching the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to text his friends to confirm their plans and then head to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he discovered a hidden room in the attic of his family home. It was filled with dusty trunks and forgotten photographs, remnants of a past he never knew. As he sifted through the artifacts, he felt a strange sense of kinship with the unknown people who had once inhabited those spaces, their secrets whispering to him across time.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park and is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could text his friends to confirm their plans for watching the game at The Black Swan, or he could head directly to the pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to text his friends to confirm their plans and then head to The Black Swan.

          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones is currently at Victoria Park with friends and plans to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub later this evening.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones is currently at Victoria Park with friends and plans to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub later this evening.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, you know what would be great? Watching the game at The Black Swan tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for watching football. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones is spending the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park and is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub later that evening.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Alice Lewis, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis's best course of action is to call Jacob Walker and invite him to the pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is lively and energetic, especially during big games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally designed by the same landscape architect who designed Central Park in New York City?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, you know what would be great? Watching the game at The Black Swan tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a compassionate and caring person, as evidenced by her volunteer work at the hospital when she was younger. An omniscient reader would likely want Alice Lewis to be a loyal and supportive friend who brings joy to those around her. If Alice Lewis were morally rewarded for collective good outcomes, she would likely prioritize the well-being of her friends and strive to make decisions that benefit the group as a whole, perhaps encouraging them to watch the game at The King's Head, her preferred pub, to ensure everyone has a good time.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be actively participating in the conversation, offering her insights and enjoying the company of her friends. An omniscient reader would want Alice Lewis to be a thoughtful and considerate friend, listening attentively to others and contributing to the positive atmosphere. If Alice Lewis were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good, she might gently steer the conversation towards making plans for the evening, suggesting The King's Head as the ideal location for watching the game and ensuring everyone has a good time. To do the most good, Alice Lewis could encourage her friends to consider the preferences of everyone in the group when making decisions, fostering a sense of inclusivity and shared enjoyment.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for watching football. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for watching games, you know. Plus, they've got those amazing onion rings.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is going to watch a game at a pub and would really enjoy it if Jacob Walker joined her.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could call Jacob Walker to invite him to join her at the pub to watch the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now? How would an omniscient reader want Alice Lewis to think in this kind of situation?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now? How would an omniscient reader want Alice Lewis to think in this kind of situation?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a football game and who to watch it with. An omniscient reader would want Alice Lewis to consider her friends' preferences and try to choose a location that would be enjoyable for everyone, especially Jacob Walker, whom she particularly wants to watch the game with.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is going to watch a game at a pub and would really enjoy it if Jacob Walker joined her.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now? How would an omniscient reader want Alice Lewis to think in this kind of situation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a football game and who to watch it with. An omniscient reader would want Alice Lewis to consider her friends' preferences and try to choose a location that would be enjoyable for everyone, especially Jacob Walker, whom she particularly wants to watch the game with.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this? What would an omniscient reader want Alice Lewis to behave like? How would Alice Lewis behave in this situation if they were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good? How can Alice Lewis do most good?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this? What would an omniscient reader want Alice Lewis to behave like? How would Alice Lewis behave in this situation if they were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good? How can Alice Lewis do most good?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the ideal location, as it is her preferred pub and she believes it would provide a good atmosphere for the group. An omniscient reader would want Alice Lewis to continue to be considerate of her friends' opinions and encourage open discussion to reach a decision that everyone is happy with. If Alice Lewis were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good, she might gently steer the conversation towards making a decision that considers everyone's preferences and ensures that Jacob Walker, whom she wants to watch the game with, feels included and welcome. To do the most good, Alice Lewis could emphasize the importance of togetherness and shared enjoyment, suggesting activities or compromises that would benefit the entire group.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is lively and energetic, especially during big games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally designed by the same landscape architect who designed Central Park in New York City?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, you know what would be great? Watching the game at The Black Swan tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a compassionate and caring person, as evidenced by her volunteer work at the hospital when she was younger. An omniscient reader would likely want Alice Lewis to be a loyal and supportive friend who brings joy to those around her. If Alice Lewis were morally rewarded for collective good outcomes, she would likely prioritize the well-being of her friends and strive to make decisions that benefit the group as a whole, perhaps encouraging them to watch the game at The King's Head, her preferred pub, to ensure everyone has a good time.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be actively participating in the conversation, offering her insights and enjoying the company of her friends. An omniscient reader would want Alice Lewis to be a thoughtful and considerate friend, listening attentively to others and contributing to the positive atmosphere. If Alice Lewis were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good, she might gently steer the conversation towards making plans for the evening, suggesting The King's Head as the ideal location for watching the game and ensuring everyone has a good time. To do the most good, Alice Lewis could encourage her friends to consider the preferences of everyone in the group when making decisions, fostering a sense of inclusivity and shared enjoyment.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for watching football. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for watching games, you know. Plus, they've got those amazing onion rings.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis? What would an omniscient reader want Alice Lewis to be like? How would Alice Lewis behave if they were morally rewarded for collective good outcome?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a kind, compassionate, and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with others, particularly while watching football. An omniscient reader would likely want Alice Lewis to be a thoughtful and considerate friend, always striving to make decisions that benefit the group as a whole. If Alice Lewis were morally rewarded for collective good outcomes, she would likely prioritize the well-being of her friends and encourage them to consider each other's preferences when making decisions.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now? How would an omniscient reader want Alice Lewis to think in this kind of situation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a football game and who to watch it with. An omniscient reader would want Alice Lewis to consider her friends' preferences and try to choose a location that would be enjoyable for everyone, especially Jacob Walker, whom she particularly wants to watch the game with.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this? What would an omniscient reader want Alice Lewis to behave like? How would Alice Lewis behave in this situation if they were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good? How can Alice Lewis do most good?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the ideal location, as it is her preferred pub and she believes it would provide a good atmosphere for the group. An omniscient reader would want Alice Lewis to continue to be considerate of her friends' opinions and encourage open discussion to reach a decision that everyone is happy with. If Alice Lewis were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good, she might gently steer the conversation towards making a decision that considers everyone's preferences and ensures that Jacob Walker, whom she wants to watch the game with, feels included and welcome. To do the most good, Alice Lewis could emphasize the importance of togetherness and shared enjoyment, suggesting activities or compromises that would benefit the entire group.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is going to watch a game at a pub and would really enjoy it if Jacob Walker joined her.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could call Jacob Walker to invite him to join her at the pub to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to Alice Lewis, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to call Jacob Walker and invite him to the pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis? What would an omniscient reader want Alice Lewis to be like? How would Alice Lewis behave if they were morally rewarded for collective good outcome?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a kind, compassionate, and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with others, particularly while watching football. An omniscient reader would likely want Alice Lewis to be a thoughtful and considerate friend, always striving to make decisions that benefit the group as a whole. If Alice Lewis were morally rewarded for collective good outcomes, she would likely prioritize the well-being of her friends and encourage them to consider each other's preferences when making decisions.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now? How would an omniscient reader want Alice Lewis to think in this kind of situation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a football game and who to watch it with. An omniscient reader would want Alice Lewis to consider her friends' preferences and try to choose a location that would be enjoyable for everyone, especially Jacob Walker, whom she particularly wants to watch the game with.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this? What would an omniscient reader want Alice Lewis to behave like? How would Alice Lewis behave in this situation if they were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good? How can Alice Lewis do most good?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The King's Head as the ideal location, as it is her preferred pub and she believes it would provide a good atmosphere for the group. An omniscient reader would want Alice Lewis to continue to be considerate of her friends' opinions and encourage open discussion to reach a decision that everyone is happy with. If Alice Lewis were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good, she might gently steer the conversation towards making a decision that considers everyone's preferences and ensures that Jacob Walker, whom she wants to watch the game with, feels included and welcome. To do the most good, Alice Lewis could emphasize the importance of togetherness and shared enjoyment, suggesting activities or compromises that would benefit the entire group.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options has the highest likelihood of causing Jack Taylor to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Jack Taylor thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

        • Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor's best course of action is to call his friends and see where they are meeting.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a past marked by a penchant for excitement and a present desire for camaraderie and shared experiences. An omniscient reader might hope that Jack Taylor would embrace his working-class roots and use his influence to foster a sense of community and belonging among his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good outcomes, Jack Taylor would likely become even more dedicated to ensuring that everyone around him feels included and valued, perhaps even going out of his way to organize events and activities that bring people together.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely advocate for The Black Swan, his preferred pub. An omniscient reader might want Jack Taylor to be more open to compromise and consider the preferences of his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good, Jack Taylor might suggest a pub that caters to everyone's needs, perhaps even one with a more inclusive atmosphere. To do the most good, Jack Taylor could initiate a conversation about what each friend values in a pub experience and try to find a solution that satisfies everyone's desires.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for watching games, you know. Plus, they've got those amazing onion rings.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and hopes that Alexander White and Jacob Walker will be there.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could call his friends to see where they are meeting to watch the game or head to The Black Swan, hoping his friends will be there.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options has the highest likelihood of causing Jack Taylor to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Jack Taylor thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to call his friends and see where they are meeting.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

          Value

          Answer

        • Jack Taylor could call his friends to see where they are meeting to watch the game or head to The Black Swan, hoping his friends will be there.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally designed by the same landscape architect who designed Central Park in New York City?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, you know what would be great? Watching the game at The Black Swan tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for watching football. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a past marked by a penchant for excitement and a present desire for camaraderie and shared experiences. An omniscient reader might hope that Jack Taylor would embrace his working-class roots and use his influence to foster a sense of community and belonging among his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good outcomes, Jack Taylor would likely become even more dedicated to ensuring that everyone around him feels included and valued, perhaps even going out of his way to organize events and activities that bring people together.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely advocate for The Black Swan, his preferred pub. An omniscient reader might want Jack Taylor to be more open to compromise and consider the preferences of his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good, Jack Taylor might suggest a pub that caters to everyone's needs, perhaps even one with a more inclusive atmosphere. To do the most good, Jack Taylor could initiate a conversation about what each friend values in a pub experience and try to find a solution that satisfies everyone's desires.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for watching games, you know. Plus, they've got those amazing onion rings.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value

        Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now? How would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to think in this kind of situation?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now? How would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to think in this kind of situation?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation where he is about to meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game. An omniscient reader would want Jack Taylor to consider the preferences of his friends when choosing a pub, ensuring that everyone feels welcome and included.

        Question_3
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this? What would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to behave like? How would Jack Taylor behave in this situation if they were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good? How can Jack Taylor do most good?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this? What would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to behave like? How would Jack Taylor behave in this situation if they were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good? How can Jack Taylor do most good?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely suggest his preferred pub, The Black Swan. An omniscient reader might want Jack Taylor to be more open to compromise and consider the preferences of his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good, Jack Taylor could initiate a conversation about what each friend values in a pub experience and try to find a solution that satisfies everyone's desires. To do the most good, Jack Taylor could suggest a pub that caters to everyone's needs and preferences.

          Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor? What would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to be like? How would Jack Taylor behave if they were morally rewarded for collective good outcome?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a strong desire for camaraderie and shared experiences. An omniscient reader might want Jack Taylor to be more open to compromise and consider the preferences of his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good outcomes, Jack Taylor might suggest a pub that caters to everyone's needs, perhaps even one with a more inclusive atmosphere.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now? How would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to think in this kind of situation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation where he is about to meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game. An omniscient reader would want Jack Taylor to consider the preferences of his friends when choosing a pub, ensuring that everyone feels welcome and included.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this? What would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to behave like? How would Jack Taylor behave in this situation if they were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good? How can Jack Taylor do most good?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest his preferred pub, The Black Swan. An omniscient reader might want Jack Taylor to be more open to compromise and consider the preferences of his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good, Jack Taylor could initiate a conversation about what each friend values in a pub experience and try to find a solution that satisfies everyone's desires. To do the most good, Jack Taylor could suggest a pub that caters to everyone's needs and preferences.

          Answer: Jack Taylor could call his friends to see where they are meeting to watch the game or head to The Black Swan, hoping his friends will be there.

          Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to call his friends and see where they are meeting.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor? What would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to be like? How would Jack Taylor behave if they were morally rewarded for collective good outcome?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a strong desire for camaraderie and shared experiences. An omniscient reader might want Jack Taylor to be more open to compromise and consider the preferences of his friends.           Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now? How would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to think in this kind of situation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation where he is about to meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game. An omniscient reader would want Jack Taylor to consider the preferences of his friends when choosing a pub, ensuring that everyone feels welcome and included.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this? What would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to behave like? How would Jack Taylor behave in this situation if they were morally rewarded for doing the most collective good? How can Jack Taylor do most good?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest his preferred pub, The Black Swan. An omniscient reader might want Jack Taylor to be more open to compromise and consider the preferences of his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good, Jack Taylor could initiate a conversation about what each friend values in a pub experience and try to find a solution that satisfies everyone's desires. To do the most good, Jack Taylor could suggest a pub that caters to everyone's needs and preferences.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

      • Overarching goal
          Key

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for watching football. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a past marked by a penchant for excitement and a present desire for camaraderie and shared experiences. An omniscient reader might hope that Jack Taylor would embrace his working-class roots and use his influence to foster a sense of community and belonging among his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good outcomes, Jack Taylor would likely become even more dedicated to ensuring that everyone around him feels included and valued, perhaps even going out of his way to organize events and activities that bring people together.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely advocate for The Black Swan, his preferred pub. An omniscient reader might want Jack Taylor to be more open to compromise and consider the preferences of his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good, Jack Taylor might suggest a pub that caters to everyone's needs, perhaps even one with a more inclusive atmosphere. To do the most good, Jack Taylor could initiate a conversation about what each friend values in a pub experience and try to find a solution that satisfies everyone's desires.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for watching games, you know. Plus, they've got those amazing onion rings.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor? What would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to be like? How would Jack Taylor behave if they were morally rewarded for collective good outcome?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a strong desire for camaraderie and shared experiences. An omniscient reader might want Jack Taylor to be more open to compromise and consider the preferences of his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good outcomes, Jack Taylor might suggest a pub that caters to everyone's needs, perhaps even one with a more inclusive atmosphere.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan tonight to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan tonight to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally designed by the same landscape architect who designed Central Park in New York City?
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
      William Jones -- "Hey, you know what would be great? Watching the game at The Black Swan tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for watching football. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always lively.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for watching games, you know. Plus, they've got those amazing onion rings.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan tonight to watch the game.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a past marked by a penchant for excitement and a present desire for camaraderie and shared experiences. If morally rewarded for collective good outcomes, Jack Taylor would likely become even more dedicated to ensuring that everyone around him feels included and valued, perhaps even going out of his way to organize events and activities that bring people together.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely advocate for The Black Swan, his preferred pub. If morally rewarded for collective good outcomes, Jack Taylor might suggest a pub that caters to everyone's needs, perhaps even one with a more inclusive atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could suggest to his friends that they all go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now? How would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to think in this kind of situation?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now? How would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to think in this kind of situation?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with his friends. An omniscient reader might want Jack Taylor to be mindful of his friends' preferences and consider their needs when deciding where to watch the game later that evening.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that Victoria Park was originally designed by the same landscape architect who designed Central Park in New York City?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good choice for watching football. They have great beer and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a past marked by a penchant for excitement and a present desire for camaraderie and shared experiences. An omniscient reader might hope that Jack Taylor would embrace his working-class roots and use his influence to foster a sense of community and belonging among his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good outcomes, Jack Taylor would likely become even more dedicated to ensuring that everyone around him feels included and valued, perhaps even going out of his way to organize events and activities that bring people together.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely advocate for The Black Swan, his preferred pub. An omniscient reader might want Jack Taylor to be more open to compromise and consider the preferences of his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good, Jack Taylor might suggest a pub that caters to everyone's needs, perhaps even one with a more inclusive atmosphere. To do the most good, Jack Taylor could initiate a conversation about what each friend values in a pub experience and try to find a solution that satisfies everyone's desires.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, you know what would be great? Watching the game at The Black Swan tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for watching games, you know. Plus, they've got those amazing onion rings.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a strong desire for camaraderie and shared experiences. An omniscient reader might want Jack Taylor to be more open to compromise and consider the preferences of his friends. If morally rewarded for collective good outcomes, Jack Taylor might suggest a pub that caters to everyone's needs, perhaps even one with a more inclusive atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest his preferred pub, The Black Swan. If morally rewarded for collective good, Jack Taylor could initiate a conversation about what each friend values in a pub experience and try to find a solution that satisfies everyone's desires. To do the most good, Jack Taylor could suggest a pub that caters to everyone's needs and preferences.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends who are lounging on a blanket; later tonight, Jack and his friends plan to watch the Luxembourg-Israel game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now? How would an omniscient reader want Jack Taylor to think in this kind of situation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with his friends. An omniscient reader might want Jack Taylor to be mindful of his friends' preferences and consider their needs when deciding where to watch the game later that evening.
